required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Emergency Department Preoxygenation Techniques in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: Four methods of preoxygenation will be compared in healthy volunteers

detailed_description.textblock:
After informed consent, each volunteer will undergo the following techniques:
Simple mask at "flush" flow (40-60 L/min) Non-rebreather mask at 15 L/min Non-rebreather mask at 60 L/min Bag valve mask with one way exhalation valve at 15 L/min
After 3 minutes, the exhaled oxygen will be measured with an oxygen sensor

primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after 3 minutes of oxygen supplementation
primary_outcome.description: Subjects will blow into an oxygen sensor after each method (arm). The primary outcome will be a non-inferiority test between bag valve mask and non-rebreather at 60 L/min. The remaining tests will be completed for comparison, but not part of formal statistical testing.

arm_group.description: All participants were enrolled in a single arm in which they underwent 4 interventions in series: 1) Simple mask at 60 L/min for 3 minutes 2) Non-rebreather at 15 L/min for 3 min 3) Non-rebreather at 60 L/min for 3 minutes 4) Bag valve mask at 15 L/min for 3 minutes

intervention.description: After 3 minutes of oxygen supplementation (preoxygenation), with each of the devices listed below, the exhaled oxygen content will be measured. All participants were enrolled in a single arm in which they underwent 4 interventions in series: 1) Simple mask at 60 L/min for 3 minutes 2) Non-rebreather at 60 L/min for 3 min 3) Non-rebreather at 15 L/min for 3 minutes 4) Bag valve mask at 15 L/min for 3 minutes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Over 18 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any active respiratory pathology (asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, other lung disease, smoking history more than 5 years)
- pregnant

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: There were 26 total subjects; each did all 4 arms.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
